subject: Re: [junit] Is there a place for private methods with TDD?

messageBody:
Kevin O'Sullivan wrote:

>
> In a class (see below) with two public methods A & B that both call private
> method C, what's the best approach for unit testing it? Should test
> scenarios for A or B cover what may happen in C ? If so, is it just accepted
> as a code management overhead to ensure that C is properly tested via tests
> for A or B ?
>
> If you use TDD would you ever end up with private methods, declaring them as
> protected instead?

In TDD, private methods generally only arise through refactoring.

If two public methods each invoke a private method, then the likelihood
is high that your class has two responsibilities. In that case, split
the class in two, then move the private method into the newly-extracted
class, then make it public.
